summary.long: Matthew is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: This is the list of ancestors of Jesus Christ, descendant of David and Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Abraham was the father of Isaac,
Isaac the father of Jacob,
Jacob the father of Judah and his brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Judah and Tamar were the father and mother of Perez and Zerah.
Perez was the father of Hezron,
Hezron the father of Ram,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ram the father of Amminadab,
Amminadab the father of Nahshon,
Nahshon the father of Salmon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Salmon and Rahab were the father and mother of Boaz.
Boaz and Ruth were the father and mother of Obed.
Obed was the father of Jesse,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesse the father of King David.
David and Uriah’s wife Bathsheba were the father and mother of Solomon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Solomon was the father of Rehoboam,
Rehoboam the father of Abijah,
Abijah the father of Asa,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Asa the father of Jehoshaphat,
Jehoshaphat the father of Joram,
Joram the father of Uzziah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Uzziah the father of Jotham,
Jotham the father of Ahaz,
Ahaz the father of Hezekiah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hezekiah the father of Manasseh,
Manasseh the father of Amon,
Amon the father of Josiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Josiah was the father of Jechoniah and his brothers.
They lived at the time when the people were exiled to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
After the exile to Babylon,
Jechoniah became the father of Shealtiel.
Shealtiel was the father of Zerubbabel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Zerubbabel the father of Abiud,
Abiud the father of Eliakim,
Eliakim the father of Azor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Azor the father of Zadok,
Zadok the father of Achim,
Achim the father of Eliud,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Eliud the father of Eleazar,
Eleazar the father of Matthan,
Matthan the father of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jacob was the father of Joseph, who was the husband of Mary.
Mary was the mother of Jesus, who is called Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So there were
14 generations from Abraham to David,
14 generations from David until the exile to Babylon,
14 generations from the exile until the Messiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The birth of Jesus Christ took place in this way: His mother Mary had been promised to Joseph in marriage. But before they were married, Mary realized that she was pregnant by the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her husband Joseph was an honorable man and did not want to disgrace her publicly. So he decided to break the marriage agreement with her secretly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph had this in mind when an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream. The angel said to him, “Joseph, descendant of David, don’t be afraid to take Mary as your wife. She is pregnant by the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She will give birth to a son, and you will name him Jesus [He Saves], because he will save his people from their sins.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All this happened so that what the Lord had spoken through the prophet came true:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The virgin will become pregnant and give birth to a son, and they will name him Immanuel,” which means “God is with us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Joseph woke up, he did what the angel of the Lord had commanded him to do. He took Mary to be his wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did not have marital relations with her before she gave birth to a son. Joseph named the child Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus was born in Bethlehem in Judea when Herod was king. After Jesus’ birth wise men  from the east arrived in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They asked, “Where is the one who was born to be the king of the Jews? We saw his star rising and have come to worship him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When King Herod and all Jerusalem heard about this, they became disturbed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He called together all the chief priests and the experts in the Scriptures and tried to find out from them where the Messiah was supposed to be born.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They told him, “In Bethlehem in Judea. The prophet wrote about this:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bethlehem in the land of Judah,
you are by no means least among the leaders of Judah.
A leader will come from you.
He will shepherd my people Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Herod secretly called the wise men and found out from them exactly when the star had appeared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he sent them to Bethlehem, he said, “Go and search carefully for the child. When you have found him, report to me so that I may go and worship him too.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After they had heard the king, they started out. The star they had seen rising led them until it stopped over the place where the child was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were overwhelmed with joy to see the star.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they entered the house, they saw the child with his mother Mary. So they bowed down and worshiped him. Then they opened their treasure chests and offered him gifts of gold, frankincense, and myrrh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God warned them in a dream not to go back to Herod. So they left for their country by another road.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After they had left, an angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream. The angel said to him, “Get up, take the child and his mother, and flee to Egypt. Stay there until I tell you, because Herod intends to search for the child and kill him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph got up, took the child and his mother, and left for Egypt that night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He stayed there until Herod died. What the Lord had spoken through the prophet came true: “I have called my son out of Egypt.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Herod saw that the wise men had tricked him, he became furious. He sent soldiers to kill all the boys two years old and younger in or near Bethlehem. This matched the exact time he had learned from the wise men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the words spoken through the prophet Jeremiah came true:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“A sound was heard in Ramah,
the sound of crying in bitter grief.
Rachel was crying for her children.
She refused to be comforted
because they were dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Herod was dead, an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph in Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel said to him, “Get up, take the child and his mother, and go to Israel. Those who tried to kill the child are dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph got up, took the child and his mother, and went to Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he heard that Archelaus had succeeded his father Herod as king of Judea, Joseph was afraid to go there. Warned in a dream, he left for Galilee
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and made his home in a city called Nazareth. So what the prophets had said came true: “He will be called a Nazarene.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later, John the Baptizer appeared in the desert of Judea. His message was,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Turn to God and change the way you think and act, because the kingdom of heaven is near.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Isaiah the prophet spoke about this man when he said,
“A voice cries out in the desert:
‘Prepare the way for the Lord!
Make his paths straight!’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John wore clothes made from camel’s hair and had a leather belt around his waist. His diet consisted of locusts and wild honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jerusalem, all Judea, and the whole Jordan Valley went to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they confessed their sins, he baptized them in the Jordan River.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he saw many Pharisees and Sadducees coming to be baptized, he said to them, “You poisonous snakes! Who showed you how to flee from God’s coming anger?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do those things that prove you have turned to God and have changed the way you think and act.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t think you can say, ‘Abraham is our ancestor.’ I can guarantee that God can raise up descendants for Abraham from these stones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ax is now ready to cut the roots of the trees. Any tree that doesn’t produce good fruit will be cut down and thrown into a fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I baptize you with water so that you will change the way you think and act. But the one who comes after me is more powerful than I. I am not worthy to remove his sandals. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His winnowing  shovel is in his hand, and he will clean up his threshing floor. He will gather his wheat into a barn, but he will burn the husks in a fire that can never be put out.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus appeared. He came from Galilee to the Jordan River to be baptized by John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But John tried to stop him and said, “I need to be baptized by you. Why are you coming to me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus answered him, “This is the way it has to be now. This is the proper way to do everything that God requires of us.”
Then John gave in to him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: After Jesus was baptized, he immediately came up from the water. Suddenly, the heavens were opened, and he saw the Spirit of God coming down as a dove to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a voice from heaven said, “This is my Son, whom I love—my Son with whom I am pleased.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Spirit led Jesus into the desert to be tempted by the devil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus did not eat anything for 40 days and 40 nights. At the end of that time, he was hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tempter came to him and said, “If you are the Son of God, tell these stones to become loaves of bread.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “Scripture says, ‘A person cannot live on bread alone but on every word that God speaks.’ ”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then the devil took him into the holy city and had him stand on the highest part of the temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to Jesus, “If you are the Son of God, jump! Scripture says, ‘He will put his angels in charge of you. They will carry you in their hands so that you never hit your foot against a rock.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Again, Scripture says, ‘Never tempt the Lord your God.’ ”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Once more the devil took him to a very high mountain and showed him all the kingdoms in the world and their glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The devil said to him, “I will give you all this if you will bow down and worship me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Go away, Satan! Scripture says, ‘Worship the Lord your God and serve only him.’ ”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then the devil left him, and angels came to take care of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus heard that John had been put in prison, he went back to Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He left Nazareth and made his home in Capernaum on the shores of the Sea of Galilee. This was in the region of Zebulun and Naphtali.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So what the prophet Isaiah had said came true:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Land of Zebulun and land of Naphtali,
on the way to the sea,
across the Jordan River,
Galilee, where foreigners live!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The people who lived in darkness
have seen a bright light.
A light has risen
for those who live in a land overshadowed by death.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From then on, Jesus began to tell people, “Turn to God and change the way you think and act, because the kingdom of heaven is near!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he was walking along the Sea of Galilee, he saw two brothers, Simon (called Peter) and Andrew. They were throwing a net into the sea because they were fishermen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Come, follow me! I will teach you how to catch people instead of fish.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They immediately left their nets and followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus went on, he saw two other brothers, James and John, the sons of Zebedee. They were in a boat with their father Zebedee preparing their nets to go fishing. He called them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they immediately left the boat and their father and followed Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus went all over Galilee. He taught in the synagogues and spread the Good News of the kingdom. He also cured every disease and sickness among the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The news about Jesus spread throughout Syria. People brought him everyone who was sick, those who suffered from any kind of disease or pain. They also brought epileptics, those who were paralyzed, and people possessed by demons, and he cured them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Large crowds followed him. They came from Galilee, the Ten Cities, Jerusalem, Judea, and from across the Jordan River.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw the crowds, he went up a mountain and sat down. His disciples came to him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he began to teach them:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Blessed are those who recognize they are spiritually helpless.
The kingdom of heaven belongs to them.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Blessed are those who mourn.
They will be comforted.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Blessed are those who are gentle.
They will inherit the earth.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for God’s approval.
They will be satisfied.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Blessed are those who show mercy.
They will be treated mercifully.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Blessed are those whose thoughts are pure.
They will see God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Blessed are those who make peace.
They will be called God’s children.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Blessed are those who are persecuted for doing what God approves of.
The kingdom of heaven belongs to them.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
“Blessed are you when people insult you,
persecute you,
lie, and say all kinds of evil things about you because of me.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Rejoice and be glad because you have a great reward in heaven!
The prophets who lived before you were persecuted in these ways.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “You are salt for the earth. But if salt loses its taste, how will it be made salty again? It is no longer good for anything except to be thrown out and trampled on by people.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “You are light for the world. A city cannot be hidden when it is located on a hill.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: No one lights a lamp and puts it under a basket. Instead, everyone who lights a lamp puts it on a lamp stand. Then its light shines on everyone in the house.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: In the same way let your light shine in front of people. Then they will see the good that you do and praise your Father in heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Don’t ever think that I came to set aside Moses’ Teachings or the Prophets. I didn’t come to set them aside but to make them come true.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: I can guarantee this truth: Until the earth and the heavens disappear, neither a period nor a comma will disappear from the Scriptures before everything has come true.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: So whoever sets aside any command that seems unimportant and teaches others to do the same will be unimportant in the kingdom of heaven. But whoever does and teaches what the commands say will be called great in the kingdom of heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: I can guarantee that unless you live a life that has God’s approval and do it more faithfully than the experts in Moses’ Teachings and Pharisees, you will never enter the kingdom of heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “You have heard that it was said to your ancestors, ‘Never murder. Whoever murders will answer for it in court.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I can guarantee that whoever is angry with another believer  will answer for it in court. Whoever calls another believer an insulting name will answer for it in the highest court. Whoever calls another believer a fool will answer for it in hellfire.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “So if you are offering your gift at the altar and remember there that another believer has something against you,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: leave your gift at the altar. First go away and make peace with that person. Then come back and offer your gift.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Make peace quickly with your opponent while you are on the way to court with him. Otherwise, he will hand you over to the judge. Then the judge will hand you over to an officer, who will throw you into prison.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: I can guarantee this truth: You will never get out until you pay every penny of your fine.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “You have heard that it was said, ‘Never commit adultery.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I can guarantee that whoever looks with lust at a woman has already committed adultery in his heart.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “So if your right eye causes you to sin, tear it out and throw it away. It is better for you to lose a part of your body than to have all of it thrown into hell.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And if your right hand leads you to sin, cut it off and throw it away. It is better for you to lose a part of your body than to have all of it go into hell.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “It has also been said, ‘Whoever divorces his wife must give her a written notice.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I can guarantee that any man who divorces his wife for any reason other than unfaithfulness makes her look as though she has committed adultery. Whoever marries a woman divorced in this way makes himself look as though he has committed adultery.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “You have heard that it was said to your ancestors, ‘Never break your oath, but give to the Lord what you swore in an oath to give him.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I tell you don’t swear an oath at all. Don’t swear an oath by heaven, which is God’s throne,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: or by the earth, which is his footstool, or by Jerusalem, which is the city of the great King.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And don’t swear an oath by your head. After all, you cannot make one hair black or white.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Simply say yes or no. Anything more than that comes from the evil one.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “You have heard that it was said, ‘An eye for an eye and a tooth for a tooth.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I tell you not to oppose an evil person. If someone slaps you on your right cheek, turn your other cheek to him as well.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: If someone wants to sue you in order to take your shirt, let him have your coat too.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: If someone forces you to go one mile, go two miles with him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Give to everyone who asks you for something. Don’t turn anyone away who wants to borrow something from you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “You have heard that it was said, ‘Love your neighbor, and hate your enemy.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I tell you this: Love your enemies, and pray for those who persecute you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: In this way you show that you are children of your Father in heaven. He makes his sun rise on people whether they are good or evil. He lets rain fall on them whether they are just or unjust.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: If you love those who love you, do you deserve a reward? Even the tax collectors do that!
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Are you doing anything remarkable if you welcome only your friends? Everyone does that!
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: That is why you must be perfect as your Father in heaven is perfect.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Be careful not to do your good works in public in order to attract attention. If you do, your Father in heaven will not reward you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: So when you give to the poor, don’t announce it with trumpet fanfare. This is what hypocrites do in the synagogues and on the streets in order to be praised by people. I can guarantee this truth: That will be their only reward.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When you give to the poor, don’t let your left hand know what your right hand is doing.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Give your contributions privately. Your Father sees what you do in private. He will reward you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “When you pray, don’t be like hypocrites. They like to stand in synagogues and on street corners to pray so that everyone can see them. I can guarantee this truth: That will be their only reward.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When you pray, go to your room and close the door. Pray privately to your Father who is with you. Your Father sees what you do in private. He will reward you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “When you pray, don’t ramble like heathens who think they’ll be heard if they talk a lot.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Don’t be like them. Your Father knows what you need before you ask him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
“This is how you should pray:
Our Father in heaven,
let your name be kept holy.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Let your kingdom come.
Let your will be done on earth
as it is done in heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Give us our daily bread today.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Forgive us as we forgive others.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Don’t allow us to be tempted.
Instead, rescue us from the evil one.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “If you forgive the failures of others, your heavenly Father will also forgive you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But if you don’t forgive others, your Father will not forgive your failures.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “When you fast, stop looking sad like hypocrites. They put on sad faces to make it obvious that they’re fasting. I can guarantee this truth: That will be their only reward.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When you fast, wash your face and comb your hair.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then your fasting won’t be obvious. Instead, it will be obvious to your Father who is with you in private. Your Father sees what you do in private. He will reward you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Stop storing up treasures for yourselves on earth, where moths and rust destroy and thieves break in and steal.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Instead, store up treasures for yourselves in heaven, where moths and rust don’t destroy and thieves don’t break in and steal.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Your heart will be where your treasure is.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “The eye is the lamp of the body. So if your eye is unclouded, your whole body will be full of light.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But if your eye is evil, your whole body will be full of darkness. If the light in you is darkness, how dark it will be!
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “No one can serve two masters. He will hate the first master and love the second, or he will be devoted to the first and despise the second. You cannot serve God and wealth.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “So I tell you to stop worrying about what you will eat, drink, or wear. Isn’t life more than food and the body more than clothes?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Look at the birds. They don’t plant, harvest, or gather the harvest into barns. Yet, your heavenly Father feeds them. Aren’t you worth more than they?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Can any of you add a single hour to your life by worrying?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “And why worry about clothes? Notice how the flowers grow in the field. They never work or spin yarn for clothes.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I say that not even Solomon in all his majesty was dressed like one of these flowers.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: That’s the way God clothes the grass in the field. Today it’s alive, and tomorrow it’s thrown into an incinerator. So how much more will he clothe you people who have so little faith?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Don’t ever worry and say, ‘What are we going to eat?’ or ‘What are we going to drink?’ or ‘What are we going to wear?’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Everyone is concerned about these things, and your heavenly Father certainly knows you need all of them.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But first, be concerned about his kingdom and what has his approval. Then all these things will be provided for you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “So don’t ever worry about tomorrow. After all, tomorrow will worry about itself. Each day has enough trouble of its own.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Stop judging so that you will not be judged.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Otherwise, you will be judged by the same standard you use to judge others. The standards you use for others will be applied to you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: So why do you see the piece of sawdust in another believer’s eye and not notice the wooden beam in your own eye?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: How can you say to another believer, ‘Let me take the piece of sawdust out of your eye,’ when you have a beam in your own eye?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: You hypocrite! First remove the beam from your own eye. Then you will see clearly to remove the piece of sawdust from another believer’s eye.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Don’t give what is holy to dogs or throw your pearls to pigs. Otherwise, they will trample them and then tear you to pieces.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Ask, and you will receive. Search, and you will find. Knock, and the door will be opened for you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Everyone who asks will receive. The one who searches will find, and for the one who knocks, the door will be opened.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “If your child asks you for bread, would any of you give him a stone?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Or if your child asks for a fish, would you give him a snake?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Even though you’re evil, you know how to give good gifts to your children. So how much more will your Father in heaven give good things to those who ask him?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Always do for other people everything you want them to do for you. That is the meaning of Moses’ Teachings and the Prophets.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Enter through the narrow gate because the gate and road that lead to destruction are wide. Many enter through the wide gate.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But the narrow gate and the road that lead to life are full of trouble. Only a few people find the narrow gate.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Beware of false prophets. They come to you disguised as sheep, but in their hearts they are vicious wolves.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
You will know them by what they produce.
“People don’t pick grapes from thornbushes or figs from thistles, do they?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: In the same way every good tree produces good fruit, but a rotten tree produces bad fruit.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: A good tree cannot produce bad fruit, and a rotten tree cannot produce good fruit.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Any tree that fails to produce good fruit is cut down and thrown into a fire.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: So you will know them by what they produce.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Not everyone who says to me, ‘Lord, Lord!’ will enter the kingdom of heaven, but only the person who does what my Father in heaven wants.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Many will say to me on that day, ‘Lord, Lord, didn’t we prophesy in your name? Didn’t we force out demons and do many miracles by the power and authority of your name?’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then I will tell them publicly, ‘I’ve never known you. Get away from me, you evil people.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Therefore, everyone who hears what I say and obeys it will be like a wise person who built a house on rock.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Rain poured, and floods came. Winds blew and beat against that house. But it did not collapse, because its foundation was on rock.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Everyone who hears what I say but doesn’t obey it will be like a foolish person who built a house on sand.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Rain poured, and floods came. Winds blew and struck that house. It collapsed, and the result was a total disaster.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When Jesus finished this speech, the crowds were amazed at his teachings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Unlike their experts in Moses’ Teachings, he taught them with authority.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus came down from the mountain, large crowds followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man with a serious skin disease came and bowed down in front of him. The man said to Jesus, “Sir, if you’re willing, you can make me clean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus reached out, touched him, and said, “I’m willing. So be clean!” Immediately, his skin disease went away, and he was clean.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Don’t tell anyone about this! Instead, show yourself to the priest. Then offer the sacrifice Moses commanded as proof to people that you are clean.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When Jesus went to Capernaum, a Roman army officer came to beg him for help.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The officer said, “Sir, my servant is lying at home paralyzed and in terrible pain.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “I’ll come to heal him.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The officer responded, “Sir, I don’t deserve to have you come into my house. But just give a command, and my servant will be healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As you know, I’m in a chain of command and have soldiers at my command. I tell one of them, ‘Go!’ and he goes, and another, ‘Come!’ and he comes. I tell my servant, ‘Do this!’ and he does it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus was amazed when he heard this. He said to those who were following him, “I can guarantee this truth: I haven’t found faith as great as this in anyone in Israel.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: I can guarantee that many will come from all over the world. They will eat with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob in the kingdom of heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The citizens of that kingdom will be thrown outside into the darkness. People will cry and be in extreme pain there.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Jesus told the officer, “Go! What you believed will be done for you.” And at that moment the servant was healed.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When Jesus went to Peter’s house, he saw Peter’s mother-in-law in bed with a fever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus touched her hand, and the fever went away. So she got up and prepared a meal for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the evening the people brought him many who were possessed by demons. He forced the evil spirits out of people with a command and cured everyone who was sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So what the prophet Isaiah had said came true: “He took away our weaknesses and removed our diseases.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, when Jesus saw a crowd around him, he ordered his disciples to cross to the other side of the Sea of Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An expert in Moses’ Teachings came to him and said, “Teacher, I’ll follow you wherever you go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told him, “Foxes have holes, and birds have nests, but the Son of Man has nowhere to sleep.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Another disciple said to him, “Sir, first let me go to bury my father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus told him, “Follow me, and let the dead bury their own dead.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Jesus’ disciples went with him as he left in a boat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suddenly, a severe storm came across the sea. The waves were covering the boat. Yet, Jesus was sleeping.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they woke him up, saying, “Lord! Save us! We’re going to die!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Why do you cowards have so little faith?” Then he got up, gave an order to the wind and the sea, and the sea became very calm.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The men were amazed and asked, “What kind of man is this? Even the wind and the sea obey him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he arrived in the territory of the Gadarenes on the other side of the Sea of Galilee, two men met him. They were possessed by demons and had come out of the tombs. No one could travel along that road because the men were so dangerous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shouted, “Why are you bothering us now, Son of God? Did you come here to torture us before it is time?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A large herd of pigs was feeding in the distance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The demons begged Jesus, “If you’re going to force us out, send us into that herd of pigs.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Go!” The demons came out and went into the pigs. Suddenly, the whole herd rushed down the cliff into the sea and died in the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who took care of the pigs ran into the city. There they reported everything, especially about the men possessed by demons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone from the city went to meet Jesus. When they saw him, they begged him to leave their territory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus got into a boat, crossed the sea, and came to his own city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Some people brought him a paralyzed man on a stretcher.
When Jesus saw their faith, he said to the man, “Cheer up, friend! Your sins are forgiven.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then some of the experts in Moses’ Teachings thought, “He’s dishonoring God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus knew what they were thinking. He asked them, “Why are you thinking evil things?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Is it easier to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to say, ‘Get up and walk’?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: I want you to know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins.” Then he said to the paralyzed man, “Get up, pick up your stretcher, and go home.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: So the man got up and went home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the crowd saw this, they were filled with awe and praised God for giving such authority to humans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus was leaving that place, he saw a man sitting in a tax office. The man’s name was Matthew. Jesus said to him, “Follow me!” So Matthew got up and followed him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Later Jesus was having dinner at Matthew’s house. Many tax collectors and sinners came to eat with Jesus and his disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees saw this and asked his disciples, “Why does your teacher eat with tax collectors and sinners?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus heard that, he said, “Healthy people don’t need a doctor; those who are sick do.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Learn what this means: ‘I want mercy, not sacrifices.’ I’ve come to call sinners, not people who think they have God’s approval.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then John’s disciples came to Jesus. They said, “Why do we and the Pharisees fast often but your disciples never do?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “Can wedding guests be sad while the groom is still with them? The time will come when the groom will be taken away from them. Then they will fast.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “No one patches an old coat with a new piece of cloth that will shrink. When the patch shrinks, it will rip away from the coat, and the tear will become worse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nor do people pour new wine into old wineskins. If they do, the skins burst, the wine runs out, and the skins are ruined. Rather, people pour new wine into fresh skins, and both are saved.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: A synagogue leader came to Jesus while he was talking to John’s disciples. He bowed down in front of Jesus and said, “My daughter just died. Come, lay your hand on her, and she will live.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus and his disciples got up and followed the man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a woman came up behind Jesus and touched the edge of his clothes. She had been suffering from chronic bleeding for twelve years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She thought, “If I only touch his clothes, I’ll get well.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus turned and saw her he said, “Cheer up, daughter! Your faith has made you well.” At that very moment the woman became well.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Jesus came to the synagogue leader’s house. He saw flute players and a noisy crowd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Leave! The girl is not dead. She’s sleeping.” But they laughed at him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the crowd had been put outside, Jesus went in, took her hand, and the girl came back to life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The news about this spread throughout that region.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus left that place, two blind men followed him. They shouted, “Have mercy on us, Son of David.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus went into a house, and the blind men followed him. He said to them, “Do you believe that I can do this?”
“Yes, Lord,” they answered.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He touched their eyes and said, “What you have believed will be done for you!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Then they could see.
He warned them, “Don’t let anyone know about this!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But they went out and spread the news about him throughout that region.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were leaving, some people brought a man to Jesus. The man was unable to talk because he was possessed by a demon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But as soon as the demon was forced out, the man began to speak.
The crowds were amazed and said, “We have never seen anything like this in Israel!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Pharisees said, “He forces demons out of people with the help of the ruler of demons.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus went to all the towns and villages. He taught in the synagogues and spread the Good News of the kingdom. He also cured every disease and sickness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he saw the crowds, he felt sorry for them. They were troubled and helpless like sheep without a shepherd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to his disciples, “The harvest is large, but the workers are few.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: So ask the Lord who gives this harvest to send workers to harvest his crops.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Jesus called his twelve disciples and gave them authority to force evil spirits out of people and to cure every disease and sickness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the names of the twelve apostles: first and foremost, Simon (who is called Peter) and his brother Andrew; James and his brother John, the sons of Zebedee;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip and Bartholomew; Thomas and Matthew the tax collector; James (son of Alphaeus), and Thaddaeus;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon the Zealot and Judas Iscariot, who later betrayed Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus sent these twelve out with the following instructions: “Don’t go among people who are not Jewish or into any Samaritan city.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Instead, go to the lost sheep of the nation of Israel.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: As you go, spread this message: ‘The kingdom of heaven is near.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Cure the sick, bring the dead back to life, cleanse those with skin diseases, and force demons out of people. Give these things without charging, since you received them without paying.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Don’t take any gold, silver, or even copper coins in your pockets.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Don’t take a traveling bag for the trip, a change of clothes, sandals, or a walking stick. After all, the worker deserves to have his needs met.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “When you go into a city or village, look for people who will listen to you there. Stay with them until you leave that place.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When you go into a house, greet the family.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: If it is a family that listens to you, allow your greeting to stand. But if it is not receptive, take back your greeting.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: If anyone doesn’t welcome you or listen to what you say, leave that house or city, and shake its dust off your feet.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: I can guarantee this truth: Judgment day will be better for Sodom and Gomorrah than for that city.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “I’m sending you out like sheep among wolves. So be as cunning as snakes but as innocent as doves.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Watch out for people who will hand you over to the Jewish courts and whip you in their synagogues.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Because of me you will even be brought in front of governors and kings to testify to them and to everyone in the world.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When they hand you over to the authorities, don’t worry about what to say or how to say it. When the time comes, you will be given what to say.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Indeed, you’re not the ones who will be speaking. The Spirit of your Father will be speaking through you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Brother will hand over brother to death; a father will hand over his child. Children will rebel against their parents and kill them.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Everyone will hate you because you are committed to me. But the person who patiently endures to the end will be saved.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: So when they persecute you in one city, flee to another. I can guarantee this truth: Before you have gone through every city in Israel, the Son of Man will come.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “A student is not better than his teacher. Nor is a slave better than his owner.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: It is enough for a student to become like his teacher and a slave like his owner. If they have called the owner of the house Beelzebul, they will certainly call the family members the same name.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: So don’t be afraid of them. Nothing has been covered that will not be exposed. Whatever is secret will be made known.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Tell in the daylight what I say to you in the dark. Shout from the housetops what you hear whispered.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Don’t be afraid of those who kill the body but cannot kill the soul. Instead, fear the one who can destroy both body and soul in hell.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Aren’t two sparrows sold for a penny? Not one of them will fall to the ground without your Father’s permission.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Every hair on your head has been counted.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Don’t be afraid! You are worth more than many sparrows.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “So I will acknowledge in front of my Father in heaven that person who acknowledges me in front of others.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I will tell my Father in heaven that I don’t know the person who tells others that he doesn’t know me.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Don’t think that I came to bring peace to earth. I didn’t come to bring peace but conflict.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: I came to turn a man against his father, a daughter against her mother, a daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: A person’s enemies will be the members of his own family.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “The person who loves his father or mother more than me does not deserve to be my disciple. The person who loves a son or daughter more than me does not deserve to be my disciple.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Whoever doesn’t take up his cross and follow me doesn’t deserve to be my disciple.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The person who tries to preserve his life will lose it, but the person who loses his life for me will preserve it.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “The person who welcomes you welcomes me, and the person who welcomes me welcomes the one who sent me.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The person who welcomes a prophet as such will receive a prophet’s reward. The person who welcomes a godly person as such will receive a godly person’s reward.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: I can guarantee this truth: Whoever gives any of my humble followers a cup of cold water because that person is my disciple will certainly never lose his reward.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: After Jesus finished giving his twelve disciples these instructions, he moved on from there to teach his message in their cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When John was in prison, he heard about the things Christ had done. So he sent his disciples
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to ask Jesus, “Are you the one who is coming, or should we look for someone else?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered John’s disciples, “Go back, and tell John what you hear and see:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blind people see again, lame people are walking, those with skin diseases are made clean, deaf people hear again, dead people are brought back to life, and poor people hear the Good News.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever doesn’t lose his faith in me is indeed blessed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were leaving, Jesus spoke to the crowds about John. “What did you go into the desert to see? Tall grass swaying in the wind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Really, what did you go to see? A man dressed in fine clothes? Those who wear fine clothes are in royal palaces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Really, what did you go to see? A prophet? Let me tell you that he is far more than a prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
John is the one about whom Scripture says,
‘I’m sending my messenger ahead of you
to prepare the way in front of you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I can guarantee this truth: Of all the people ever born, no one is greater than John the Baptizer. Yet, the least important person in the kingdom of heaven is greater than John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the time of John the Baptizer until now, the kingdom of heaven has been forcefully advancing, and forceful people have been seizing it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the Prophets and Moses’ Teachings prophesied up to the time of John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you are willing to accept their message, John is the Elijah who was to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the person who has ears listen!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How can I describe the people who are living now? They are like children who sit in the marketplaces and shout to other children,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘We played music for you,
but you didn’t dance.
We sang a funeral song,
but you didn’t show any sadness.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “John came neither eating nor drinking, and people say, ‘There’s a demon in him!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Son of Man came eating and drinking, and people say, ‘Look at him! He’s a glutton and a drunk, a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’
“Yet, wisdom is proved right by its actions.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus denounced the cities where he had worked most of his miracles because they had not changed the way they thought and acted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How horrible it will be for you, Chorazin! How horrible it will be for you, Bethsaida! If the miracles worked in you had been worked in Tyre and Sidon, they would have changed the way they thought and acted long ago in sackcloth and ashes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can guarantee that judgment day will be better for Tyre and Sidon than for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you, Capernaum, will you be lifted to heaven? No, you will go down to hell! If the miracles that had been worked in you had been worked in Sodom, it would still be there today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can guarantee that judgment day will be better for Sodom than for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Jesus said, “I praise you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, for hiding these things from wise and intelligent people and revealing them to little children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, Father, this is what pleased you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “My Father has turned everything over to me. Only the Father knows the Son. And no one knows the Father except the Son and those to whom the Son is willing to reveal him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Come to me, all who are tired from carrying heavy loads, and I will give you rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Place my yoke  over your shoulders, and learn from me, because I am gentle and humble. Then you will find rest for yourselves
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because my yoke is easy and my burden is light.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then on a day of rest—a holy day, Jesus walked through the grainfields. His disciples were hungry and began to pick the heads of grain to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Pharisees saw this, they said to him, “Look! Your disciples are doing something that is not right to do on the day of rest—a holy day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus asked them, “Haven’t you read what David did when he and his men were hungry?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Haven’t you read how he went into the house of God and ate  the bread of the presence? He and his men had no right to eat those loaves. Only the priests have that right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or haven’t you read in Moses’ Teachings that on the day of rest—a holy day, the priests in the temple do things they shouldn’t on the day of rest yet remain innocent?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can guarantee that something  greater than the temple is here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you had known what ‘I want mercy, not sacrifices’ means, you would not have condemned innocent people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Son of Man has authority over the day of rest—a holy day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus moved on from there and went into a synagogue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man with a paralyzed hand was there. The people asked Jesus whether it was right to heal on a day of rest—a holy day, so that they could accuse him of doing something wrong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Suppose one of you has a sheep. If it falls into a pit on a day of rest—a holy day, wouldn’t you take hold of it and lift it out?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Certainly, a human is more valuable than a sheep! So it is right to do good on the day of rest—a holy day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to the man, “Hold out your hand.” The man held it out, and it became normal again, as healthy as the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees left and plotted to kill Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He knew about this, so he left that place.
Many people followed him, and he cured all of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also ordered them not to tell people who he was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So what the prophet Isaiah had said came true:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Here is my servant
whom I have chosen,
whom I love,
and in whom I delight.
I will put my Spirit on him,
and he will announce justice to the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will not quarrel or shout,
and no one will hear his voice in the streets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will not break off a damaged cattail.
He will not even put out a smoking wick
until he has made justice victorious.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The nations will have hope because of him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some people brought Jesus a man possessed by a demon. The demon made the man blind and unable to talk. Jesus cured him so that he could talk and see.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The crowds were all amazed and said, “Can this man be the Son of David?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Pharisees heard this, they said, “This man can force demons out of people only with the help of Beelzebul, the ruler of demons.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since Jesus knew what they were thinking, he said to them, “Every kingdom divided against itself is ruined. And every city or household divided against itself will not last.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If Satan forces Satan out, he is divided against himself. How, then, can his kingdom last?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I force demons out of people with the help of Beelzebul, who helps your followers force them out? That’s why they will be your judges.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if I force demons out with the help of God’s Spirit, then God’s kingdom has come to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How can anyone go into a strong man’s house and steal his property? First he must tie up the strong man. Then he can go through his house and steal his property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoever isn’t with me is against me. Whoever doesn’t gather with me scatters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I can guarantee that people will be forgiven for any sin or cursing. However, cursing the Spirit will not be forgiven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever speaks a word against the Son of Man will be forgiven. But whoever speaks against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven in this world or the next.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Make a tree good, and then its fruit will be good. Or make a tree rotten, and then its fruit will be rotten. A person can recognize a tree by its fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You poisonous snakes! How can you evil people say anything good? Your mouth says what comes from inside you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Good people do the good things that are in them. But evil people do the evil things that are in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I can guarantee that on judgment day people will have to give an account of every careless word they say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By your words you will be declared innocent, or by your words you will be declared guilty.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some experts in Moses’ Teachings and Pharisees said, “Teacher, we want you to show us a miraculous sign.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He responded, “The people of an evil and unfaithful era look for a miraculous sign. But the only sign they will get is the sign of the prophet Jonah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as Jonah was in the belly of a huge fish for three days and three nights, so the Son of Man will be in the heart of the earth for three days and three nights.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men of Nineveh will stand up with you at the time of judgment and will condemn you, because they turned to God and changed the way they thought and acted when Jonah spoke his message. But look, someone greater than Jonah is here!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The queen from the south will stand up at the time of judgment with you. She will condemn you, because she came from the ends of the earth to hear Solomon’s wisdom. But look, someone greater than Solomon is here!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When an evil spirit comes out of a person, it goes through dry places looking for a place to rest. But it doesn’t find any.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then it says, ‘I’ll go back to the home I left.’ When it arrives, it finds the house unoccupied, swept clean, and in order.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then it goes and brings along seven other spirits more evil than itself. They enter and take up permanent residence there. In the end the condition of that person is worse than it was before. That is what will happen to the evil people of this day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Jesus was still talking to the crowds, his mother and brothers were standing outside. They wanted to talk to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Someone told him, “Your mother and your brothers are standing outside. They want to talk to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He replied to the man speaking to him, “Who is my mother, and who are my brothers?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pointing with his hand at his disciples, he said, “Look, here are my mother and my brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever does what my Father in heaven wants is my brother and sister and mother.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That same day Jesus left the house and sat down by the Sea of Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The crowd that gathered around him was so large that he got into a boat. He sat in the boat while the entire crowd stood on the shore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he used stories as illustrations to tell them many things.
He said, “Listen! A farmer went to plant seed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some seeds were planted along the road, and birds came and devoured them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Other seeds were planted on rocky ground, where there was little soil. The plants sprouted quickly because the soil wasn’t deep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the sun came up, they were scorched. They withered because their roots weren’t deep enough.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Other seeds were planted among thornbushes, and the thornbushes grew up and choked them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But other seeds were planted on good ground and produced grain. They produced one hundred, sixty, or thirty times as much as was planted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the person who has ears listen!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples asked him, “Why do you use stories as illustrations when you speak to people?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “Knowledge about the mysteries of the kingdom of heaven has been given to you. But it has not been given to the crowd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who understand these mysteries will be given more knowledge, and they will excel in understanding them. However, some people don’t understand these mysteries. Even what they understand will be taken away from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is why I speak to them this way. They see, but they’re blind. They hear, but they don’t listen. They don’t even try to understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So they make Isaiah’s prophecy come true:
‘You will hear clearly but never understand.
You will see clearly but never comprehend.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These people have become close-minded
and hard of hearing.
They have shut their eyes
so that their eyes never see.
Their ears never hear.
Their minds never understand.
And they never return to me for healing!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Blessed are your eyes because they see and your ears because they hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can guarantee this truth: Many prophets and many of God’s people longed to see what you see but didn’t see it, to hear what you hear but didn’t hear it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Listen to what the story about the farmer means.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Someone hears the word about the kingdom but doesn’t understand it. The evil one comes at once and snatches away what was planted in him. This is what the seed planted along the road illustrates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seed planted on rocky ground is the person who hears the word and accepts it at once with joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since he doesn’t have any root, he lasts only a little while. When suffering or persecution comes along because of the word, he immediately falls from faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seed planted among thornbushes is another person who hears the word. But the worries of life and the deceitful pleasures of riches choke the word so that it can’t produce anything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the seed planted on good ground is the person who hears and understands the word. This type produces crops. They produce one hundred, sixty, or thirty times as much as was planted.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus used another illustration. He said, “The kingdom of heaven is like a man who planted good seed in his field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But while people were asleep, his enemy planted weeds in the wheat field and went away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the wheat came up and formed kernels, weeds appeared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The owner’s workers came to him and asked, ‘Sir, didn’t you plant good seed in your field? Where did the weeds come from?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“He told them, ‘An enemy did this.’
“His workers asked him, ‘Do you want us to pull out the weeds?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He replied, ‘No. If you pull out the weeds, you may pull out the wheat with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let both grow together until the harvest. When the grain is cut, I will tell the workers to gather the weeds first and tie them in bundles to be burned. But I’ll have them bring the wheat into my barn.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus used another illustration. He said, “The kingdom of heaven is like a mustard seed that someone planted in a field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It’s one of the smallest seeds. However, when it has grown, it is taller than the garden plants. It becomes a tree that is large enough for birds to nest in its branches.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He used another illustration. “The kingdom of heaven is like yeast that a woman mixed into a large amount of flour until the yeast worked its way through all the dough.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus used illustrations to tell the crowds all these things. He did not tell them anything without illustrating it with a story.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So what the prophet had said came true:
“I will open my mouth to illustrate points.
I will tell what has been hidden since the world was made.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus had sent the people away, he went into the house. His disciples came to him and said, “Explain what the illustration of the weeds in the field means.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered, “The one who plants the good seeds is the Son of Man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The field is the world. The good seeds are those who belong to the kingdom. The weeds are those who belong to the evil one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The enemy who planted them is the devil. The harvest is the end of the world. The workers are angels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as weeds are gathered and burned, so it will be at the end of time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of Man will send his angels. They will gather everything in his kingdom that causes people to sin and everyone who does evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angels will throw them into a blazing furnace. People will cry and be in extreme pain there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the people who have God’s approval will shine like the sun in their Father’s kingdom. Let the person who has ears listen!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The kingdom of heaven is like a treasure buried in a field. When a man discovered it, he buried it again. He was so delighted with it that he went away, sold everything he had, and bought that field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Also, the kingdom of heaven is like a merchant who was searching for fine pearls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he found a valuable pearl, he went away, sold everything he had, and bought it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Also, the kingdom of heaven is like a net that was thrown into the sea. It gathered all kinds of fish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it was full, they pulled it to the shore. Then they sat down, gathered the good fish into containers, and threw the bad ones away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The same thing will happen at the end of time. The angels will go out and separate the evil people from people who have God’s approval.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the angels will throw the evil people into a blazing furnace. They will cry and be in extreme pain there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Have you understood all of this?”
“Yes,” they answered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus said to them, “That is why every student of the Scriptures who has become a disciple of the kingdom of heaven is like a home owner. He brings new and old things out of his treasure chest.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus had finished these illustrations, he left that place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus went to his hometown and taught the people in the synagogue in a way that amazed them. People were asking, “Where did this man get this wisdom and the power to do these miracles?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Isn’t this the carpenter’s son? Isn’t his mother’s name Mary? Aren’t his brothers’ names James, Joseph, Simon, and Judas?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And aren’t all his sisters here with us? Where, then, did this man get all this?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So they took offense at him.
But Jesus said to them, “The only place a prophet isn’t honored is in his hometown and in his own house.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He didn’t work many miracles there because of their lack of faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Herod, ruler of Galilee, heard the news about Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to his officials, “This is John the Baptizer! He has come back to life. That’s why he has the power to perform these miracles.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Herod had arrested John, tied him up, and put him in prison. Herod did this for Herodias, the wife of his brother Philip.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John had been telling Herod, “It’s not right for you to be married to her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Herod wanted to kill John. However, he was afraid of the people because they thought John was a prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Herod celebrated his birthday, Herodias’ daughter danced for his guests. Herod was so delighted with her that
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he swore he would give her anything she wanted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Urged by her mother, she said, “Give me the head of John the Baptizer on a platter.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king regretted his promise. But because of his oath and his guests, he ordered that her wish be granted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He had John’s head cut off in prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the head was brought on a platter and given to the girl, who took it to her mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John’s disciples came for the body and buried it. Then they went to tell Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus heard about John, he left in a boat and went to a place where he could be alone. The crowds heard about this and followed him on foot from the cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus got out of the boat, he saw a large crowd. He felt sorry for them and cured their sick people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the evening the disciples came to him. They said, “No one lives around here, and it’s already late. Send the crowds to the villages to buy food for themselves.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “They don’t need to go away. You give them something to eat.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They told him, “All we have here are five loaves of bread and two fish.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “Bring them to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he ordered the people to sit down on the grass. After he took the five loaves and the two fish, he looked up to heaven and blessed the food. He broke the loaves apart, gave them to the disciples, and they gave them to the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of them ate as much as they wanted. When they picked up the leftover pieces, they filled twelve baskets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About five thousand men had eaten. (This number does not include the women and children who had eaten.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus quickly made his disciples get into a boat and cross to the other side ahead of him while he sent the people away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After sending the people away, he went up a mountain to pray by himself. When evening came, he was there alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The boat, now hundreds of yards from shore, was being thrown around by the waves because it was going against the wind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Between three and six o’clock in the morning, he came to them. He was walking on the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the disciples saw him walking on the sea, they were terrified. They said, “It’s a ghost!” and began to scream because they were afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately, Jesus said, “Calm down! It’s me. Don’t be afraid!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter answered, “Lord, if it is you, order me to come to you on the water.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “Come!” So Peter got out of the boat and walked on the water toward Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he noticed how strong the wind was, he became afraid and started to sink. He shouted, “Lord, save me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately, Jesus reached out, caught hold of him, and said, “You have so little faith! Why did you doubt?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they got into the boat, the wind stopped blowing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men in the boat bowed down in front of Jesus and said, “You are truly the Son of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They crossed the sea and landed at Gennesaret.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men there recognized Jesus and sent messengers all around the countryside. The people brought him everyone who was sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They begged him to let them touch just the edge of his clothes. Everyone who touched his clothes was made well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some Pharisees and experts in Moses’ Teachings came from Jerusalem to Jesus. They asked,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why do your disciples break the traditions of our ancestors? They do not wash their hands before they eat.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered them, “Why do you break the commandment of God because of your traditions?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For example, God said, ‘Honor your father and your mother’ and ‘Whoever curses father or mother must be put to death.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you say that whoever tells his father or mother, ‘I have given to God whatever support you might have received from me,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: does not have to honor his father. Because of your traditions you have destroyed the authority of God’s word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You hypocrites! Isaiah was right when he prophesied about you:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘These people honor me with their lips,
but their hearts are far from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their worship of me is pointless,
because their teachings are rules made by humans.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he called the crowd and said to them, “Listen and try to understand!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What goes into a person’s mouth doesn’t make him unclean. It’s what comes out of the mouth that makes a person unclean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the disciples came and said to him, “Do you realize that when the Pharisees heard your statement they were offended?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered, “Any plant that my heavenly Father did not plant will be uprooted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Leave them alone! They are blind leaders. When one blind person leads another, both will fall into the same pit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said to him, “Explain this illustration to us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “Don’t you understand yet?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t you know that whatever goes into the mouth goes into the stomach and then into a toilet?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But whatever goes out of the mouth comes from within, and that’s what makes a person unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Evil thoughts, murder, adultery, other sexual sins, stealing, lying, and cursing come from within.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the things that make a person unclean. But eating without washing one’s hands doesn’t make a person unclean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus left that place and went to the region of Tyre and Sidon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A Canaanite woman from that territory came to him and began to shout, “Have mercy on me, Lord, Son of David! My daughter is tormented by a demon.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he did not answer her at all. Then his disciples came to him and urged him, “Send her away. She keeps shouting behind us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus responded, “I was sent only to the lost sheep of the nation of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She came to him, bowed down, and said, “Lord, help me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “It’s not right to take the children’s food and throw it to the dogs.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She said, “You’re right, Lord. But even the dogs eat scraps that fall from their masters’ tables.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus answered her, “Woman, you have strong faith! What you wanted will be done for you.” At that moment her daughter was cured.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus moved on from there and went along the Sea of Galilee. Then he went up a mountain and sat there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A large crowd came to him, bringing with them the lame, blind, disabled, those unable to talk, and many others. They laid them at his feet, and he cured them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The crowd was amazed to see mute people talking, the disabled cured, the lame walking, and the blind seeing. So they praised the God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus called his disciples and said, “I feel sorry for the people. They have been with me three days now and have nothing to eat. I don’t want to send them away hungry, or they may become exhausted on their way home.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His disciples asked him, “Where could we get enough bread to feed such a crowd in this place where no one lives?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus asked them, “How many loaves of bread do you have?”
They answered, “Seven, and a few small fish.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He ordered the crowd to sit down on the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took the seven loaves and the fish and gave thanks to God. Then he broke the bread and gave it to the disciples, and they gave the bread and fish to the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of them ate as much as they wanted. The disciples picked up the leftover pieces and filled seven large baskets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Four thousand men had eaten. (This number does not include the women and children who had eaten.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After he sent the people on their way, Jesus stepped into the boat and came to the territory of Magadan.
verses.speaker: Narrator
