verses.text: The Pharisees and Sadducees came to test Jesus. So they asked him to show them a miraculous sign from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He responded to them, “In the evening you say that the weather will be fine because the sky is red.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the morning you say that there will be a storm today because the sky is red and overcast. You can forecast the weather by judging the appearance of the sky, but you cannot interpret the signs of the times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Evil and unfaithful people look for a miraculous sign. But the only sign they will be given is that of Jonah.”
Then he left them standing there and went away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples had forgotten to take any bread along when they went to the other side of the Sea of Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Be careful! Watch out for the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples had been discussing among themselves that they had not taken any bread along.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus knew about their conversation and asked, “Why are you discussing among yourselves that you don’t have any bread? You have so little faith!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t you understand yet? Don’t you remember the five loaves for the five thousand and how many baskets you filled?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t you remember the seven loaves for the four thousand and how many large baskets you filled?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why don’t you understand that I wasn’t talking to you about bread? Watch out for the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they understood that he didn’t say to watch out for the yeast in bread, but to watch out for the teachings of the Pharisees and Sadducees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus came to the region of Caesarea Philippi, he asked his disciples, “Who do people say the Son of Man is?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered, “Some say you are John the Baptizer, others Elijah, still others Jeremiah or one of the prophets.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He asked them, “But who do you say I am?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter answered, “You are the Messiah, the Son of the living God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “Simon, son of Jonah, you are blessed! No human revealed this to you, but my Father in heaven revealed it to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are Peter, and I can guarantee that on this rock  I will build my church. And the gates of hell will not overpower it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will give you the keys of the kingdom of heaven. Whatever you imprison, God will imprison. And whatever you set free, God will set free.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he strictly ordered the disciples not to tell anyone that he was the Messiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From that time on Jesus began to inform his disciples that he had to go to Jerusalem. There he would have to suffer a lot because of the leaders, the chief priests, and the experts in Moses’ Teachings. He would be killed, but on the third day he would be brought back to life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter took him aside and objected to this. He said, “Heaven forbid, Lord! This must never happen to you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus turned and said to Peter, “Get out of my way, Satan! You are tempting me to sin. You aren’t thinking the way God thinks but the way humans think.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to his disciples, “Those who want to come with me must say no to the things they want, pick up their crosses, and follow me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who want to save their lives will lose them. But those who lose their lives for me will find them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What good will it do for people to win the whole world and lose their lives? Or what will a person give in exchange for life?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of Man will come with his angels in his Father’s glory. Then he will pay back each person based on what that person has done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can guarantee this truth: Some people who are standing here will not die until they see the Son of Man coming in his kingdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After six days Jesus took Peter, James, and John (the brother of James) and led them up a high mountain where they could be alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus’ appearance changed in front of them. His face became as bright as the sun and his clothes as white as light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suddenly, Moses and Elijah appeared to them and were talking with Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said to Jesus, “Lord, it’s good that we’re here. If you want, I’ll put up three tents here—one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was still speaking when a bright cloud overshadowed them. Then a voice came out of the cloud and said, “This is my Son, whom I love and with whom I am pleased. Listen to him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples were terrified when they heard this and fell facedown on the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus touched them and said, “Get up, and don’t be afraid!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they raised their heads, they saw no one but Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On their way down the mountain, Jesus ordered them, “Don’t tell anyone what you have seen. Wait until the Son of Man has been brought back to life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the disciples asked him, “Why do the experts in Moses’ Teachings say that Elijah must come first?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “Elijah is coming and will put everything in order again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Actually, I can guarantee that Elijah has already come. Yet, people treated him as they pleased because they didn’t recognize him. In the same way they’re going to make the Son of Man suffer.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the disciples understood that he was talking about John the Baptizer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to a crowd, a man came up to Jesus, knelt in front of him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “Sir, have mercy on my son. He suffers from seizures. Often he falls into fire or water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I brought him to your disciples, but they couldn’t cure him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “You unbelieving and corrupt generation! How long must I be with you? How long must I put up with you? Bring him here to me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus ordered the demon to come out of the boy. At that moment the boy was cured.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the disciples came to Jesus privately and asked, “Why couldn’t we force the demon out of the boy?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them, “Because you have so little faith. I can guarantee this truth: If your faith is the size of a mustard seed, you can say to this mountain, ‘Move from here to there,’ and it will move. Nothing will be impossible for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were traveling together in Galilee, Jesus told them, “The Son of Man will be betrayed and handed over to people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will kill him, but on the third day he will be brought back to life.” Then the disciples became very sad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to Capernaum, the collectors of the temple tax came to Peter. They asked him, “Doesn’t your teacher pay the temple tax?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Certainly,” he answered.
Peter went into the house. Before he could speak, Jesus asked him, “What do you think, Simon? From whom do the kings of the world collect fees or taxes? Is it from their family members or from other people?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“From other people,” Peter answered.
Jesus said to him, “Then the family members are exempt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, so that we don’t create a scandal, go to the sea and throw in a hook. Take the first fish that you catch. Open its mouth, and you will find a coin. Give that coin to them for you and me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time the disciples came to Jesus and asked, “Who is greatest in the kingdom of heaven?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He called a little child and had him stand among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to them, “I can guarantee this truth: Unless you change and become like little children, you will never enter the kingdom of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever becomes like this little child is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whoever welcomes a child like this in my name welcomes me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “These little ones believe in me. It would be best for the person who causes one of them to lose faith to be drowned in the sea with a large stone hung around his neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How horrible it will be for the world because it causes people to lose their faith. Situations that cause people to lose their faith will arise. How horrible it will be for the person who causes someone to lose his faith!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If your hand or your foot causes you to lose your faith, cut it off and throw it away. It is better for you to enter life disabled or injured than to have two hands or two feet and be thrown into everlasting fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If your eye causes you to lose your faith, tear it out and throw it away. It is better for you to enter life with one eye than to have two eyes and be thrown into hellfire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Be careful not to despise these little ones. I can guarantee that their angels in heaven always see the face of my Father, who is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What do you think? Suppose a man has 100 sheep and one of them strays. Won’t he leave the 99 sheep in the hills to look for the one that has strayed?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can guarantee this truth: If he finds it, he is happier about it than about the 99 that have not strayed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way, your Father in heaven does not want one of these little ones to be lost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a believer does something wrong, go, confront him when the two of you are alone. If he listens to you, you have won back that believer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he does not listen, take one or two others with you so that every accusation may be verified by two or three witnesses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he ignores these witnesses, tell it to the community of believers. If he also ignores the community, deal with him as you would a heathen or a tax collector.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can guarantee this truth: Whatever you imprison, God will imprison. And whatever you set free, God will set free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I can guarantee again that if two of you agree on anything here on earth, my Father in heaven will accept it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where two or three have come together in my name, I am there among them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter came to Jesus and asked him, “Lord, how often do I have to forgive a believer who wrongs me? Seven times?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “I tell you, not just seven times, but seventy times seven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “That is why the kingdom of heaven is like a king who wanted to settle accounts with his servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he began to do this, a servant who owed him millions of dollars was brought to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because he could not pay off the debt, the master ordered him, his wife, his children, and all that he had to be sold to pay off the account.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the servant fell at his master’s feet and said, ‘Be patient with me, and I will repay everything!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The master felt sorry for his servant, freed him, and canceled his debt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when that servant went away, he found a servant who owed him hundreds of dollars. He grabbed the servant he found and began to choke him. ‘Pay what you owe!’ he said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then that other servant fell at his feet and begged him, ‘Be patient with me, and I will repay you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he refused. Instead, he turned away and had that servant put into prison until he would repay what he owed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The other servants who worked with him saw what had happened and felt very sad. They told their master the whole story.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then his master sent for him and said to him, ‘You evil servant! I canceled your entire debt, because you begged me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shouldn’t you have treated the other servant as mercifully as I treated you?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “His master was so angry that he handed him over to the torturers until he would repay everything that he owed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That is what my Father in heaven will do to you if each of you does not sincerely forgive other believers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus finished speaking, he left Galilee and traveled along the other side of the Jordan River to the territory of Judea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Large crowds followed him, and he healed them there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some Pharisees came to test him. They asked, “Can a man divorce his wife for any reason?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “Haven’t you read that the Creator made them male and female in the beginning
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that he said, ‘That’s why a man will leave his father and mother and will remain united with his wife, and the two will be one’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they are no longer two but one. Therefore, don’t let anyone separate what God has joined together.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees asked him, “Why, then, did Moses order a man to give his wife a written notice to divorce her?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Moses allowed you to divorce your wives because you’re heartless. It was never this way in the beginning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can guarantee that whoever divorces his wife for any reason other than her unfaithfulness is committing adultery if he marries another woman.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples said to him, “If that is the only reason a man can use to divorce his wife, it’s better not to get married.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered them, “Not everyone can do what you suggest. Only those who have that gift can.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For example, some men are celibate because they were born that way. Others are celibate because they were castrated. Still others have decided to be celibate because of the kingdom of heaven. If anyone can do what you’ve suggested, then he should do it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some people brought little children to Jesus to have him bless them and pray for them. But the disciples told the people not to do that.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “Don’t stop children from coming to me! Children like these are part of God’s kingdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Jesus blessed them, he went away from there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a man came to Jesus and said, “Teacher, what good deed should I do to gain eternal life?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Why do you ask me about what is good? There is only one who is good. If you want to enter into life, obey the commandments.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Which commandments?” the man asked.
Jesus said, “Never murder. Never commit adultery. Never steal. Never give false testimony.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Honor your father and mother. Love your neighbor as you love yourself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The young man replied, “I have obeyed all these commandments. What else do I need to do?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “If you want to be perfect, sell what you own. Give the money to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then follow me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the young man heard this, he went away sad because he owned a lot of property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to his disciples, “I can guarantee this truth: It will be hard for a rich person to enter the kingdom of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can guarantee again that it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich person to enter God’s kingdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He amazed his disciples more than ever when they heard this. “Then who can be saved?” they asked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus looked at them and said, “It is impossible for people to save themselves, but everything is possible for God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter replied to him, “Look, we’ve given up everything to follow you. What will we get out of it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “I can guarantee this truth: When the Son of Man sits on his glorious throne in the world to come, you, my followers, will also sit on twelve thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And everyone who gave up homes, brothers or sisters, father, mother, children, or fields because of my name will receive a hundred times more and will inherit eternal life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, many who are first will be last, and many who are last will be first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The kingdom of heaven is like a landowner who went out at daybreak to hire workers for his vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After agreeing to pay the workers the usual day’s wages, he sent them to work in his vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About 9 a.m. he saw others standing in the marketplace without work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, ‘Work in my vineyard, and I’ll give you whatever is right.’ So they went.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He went out again about noon and 3 p.m. and did the same thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About 5 p.m. he went out and found some others standing around. He said to them, ‘Why are you standing here all day long without work?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“ ‘No one has hired us,’ they answered him.
“He said to them, ‘Work in my vineyard.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When evening came, the owner of the vineyard told the supervisor, ‘Call the workers, and give them their wages. Start with the last, and end with the first.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Those who started working about 5 p.m. came, and each received a day’s wages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When those who had been hired first came, they expected to receive more. But each of them received a day’s wages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Although they took it, they began to protest to the owner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, ‘These last workers have worked only one hour. Yet, you’ve treated us all the same, even though we worked hard all day under a blazing sun.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The owner said to one of them, ‘Friend, I’m not treating you unfairly. Didn’t you agree with me on a day’s wages?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take your money and go! I want to give this last worker as much as I gave you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Can’t I do what I want with my own money? Or do you resent my generosity towards others?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “In this way the last will be first, and the first will be last.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus was on his way to Jerusalem, he took the twelve apostles aside and said to them privately,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “We’re going to Jerusalem. There the Son of Man will be betrayed to the chief priests and the experts in Moses’ Teachings. They will condemn him to death
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and hand him over to foreigners. They will make fun of him, whip him, and crucify him. But on the third day he will be brought back to life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the mother of Zebedee’s sons came to Jesus with her two sons. She bowed down in front of him to ask him for a favor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“What do you want?” he asked her.
She said to him, “Promise that one of my sons will sit at your right and the other at your left in your kingdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus replied, “You don’t realize what you’re asking. Can you drink the cup that I’m going to drink?”
“We can,” they told him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “You will drink my cup. But I don’t have the authority to grant you a seat at my right or left. My Father has already prepared these positions for certain people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the other ten apostles heard about this, they were irritated with the two brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus called the apostles and said, “You know that the rulers of nations have absolute power over people and their officials have absolute authority over people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But that’s not the way it’s going to be among you. Whoever wants to become great among you will be your servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever wants to be most important among you will be your slave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It’s the same way with the Son of Man. He didn’t come so that others could serve him. He came to serve and to give his life as a ransom for many people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were leaving Jericho, a large crowd followed Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two blind men were sitting by the road. When they heard that Jesus was passing by, they shouted, “Lord, Son of David, have mercy on us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The crowd told them to be quiet. But they shouted even louder, “Lord, Son of David, have mercy on us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus stopped and called them. “What do you want me to do for you?” he asked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They told him, “Lord, we want you to give us our eyesight back.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus felt sorry for them, so he touched their eyes. Their sight was restored at once, and they followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came near Jerusalem and had reached Bethphage on the Mount of Olives, Jesus sent two disciples ahead of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Go into the village ahead of you. You will find a donkey tied there and a colt with it. Untie them, and bring them to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone says anything to you, tell him that the Lord needs them. That person will send them at once.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This happened so that what the prophet had said came true:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Tell the people of Zion,
‘Your king is coming to you.
He’s gentle,
riding on a donkey,
on a colt, a young pack animal.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples did as Jesus had directed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought the donkey and the colt and put their coats on them for Jesus to sit on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Most of the people spread their coats on the road. Others cut branches from the trees and spread them on the road.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The crowd that went ahead of him and that followed him was shouting,
“Hosanna to the Son of David!
Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the Lord!
Hosanna in the highest heaven!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus came into Jerusalem, the whole city was in an uproar. People were asking, “Who is this?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The crowd answered, “This is the prophet Jesus from Nazareth in Galilee.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus went into the temple courtyard and threw out everyone who was buying and selling there. He overturned the moneychangers’ tables and the chairs of those who sold pigeons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them, “Scripture says, ‘My house will be called a house of prayer,’ but you’re turning it into a gathering place for thieves!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blind and lame people came to him in the temple courtyard, and he healed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the chief priests and the experts in Moses’ Teachings saw the amazing miracles he performed and the children shouting in the temple courtyard, “Hosanna to the Son of David!” they were irritated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They said to him, “Do you hear what these children are saying?”
Jesus replied, “Yes, I do. Have you never read, ‘From the mouths of little children and infants, you have created praise’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He left them and went out of the city to Bethany and spent the night there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the morning, as Jesus returned to the city, he became hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he saw a fig tree by the road, he went up to the tree and found nothing on it but leaves. He said to the tree, “May fruit never grow on you again!” At once the fig tree dried up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples were surprised to see this. They asked, “How did the fig tree dry up so quickly?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “I can guarantee this truth: If you have faith and do not doubt, you will be able to do what I did to the fig tree. You could also say to this mountain, ‘Be uprooted and thrown into the sea,’ and it will happen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have faith that you will receive whatever you ask for in prayer.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus went into the temple courtyard and began to teach. The chief priests and the leaders of the people came to him. They asked, “What gives you the right to do these things? Who told you that you could do this?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “I, too, have a question for you. If you answer it for me, I’ll tell you why I have the right to do these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Did John’s right to baptize come from heaven or from humans?”
They discussed this among themselves. They said, “If we say, ‘from heaven,’ he will ask us, ‘Then why didn’t you believe him?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if we say, ‘from humans,’ we’re afraid of what the crowd might do. All those people think of John as a prophet.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So they answered Jesus, “We don’t know.”
Jesus told them, “Then I won’t tell you why I have the right to do these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What do you think about this? A man had two sons. He went to the first and said, ‘Son, go to work in the vineyard today.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “His son replied, ‘I don’t want to!’ But later he changed his mind and went.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The father went to the other son and told him the same thing. He replied, ‘I will, sir,’ but he didn’t go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Which of the two sons did what the father wanted?”
“The first,” they answered.
Jesus said to them, “I can guarantee this truth: Tax collectors and prostitutes are going into God’s kingdom ahead of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John came to you and showed you the way that God wants you to live, but you didn’t believe him. The tax collectors and prostitutes believed him. But even after you had seen that, you didn’t change your minds and believe him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Listen to another illustration. A landowner planted a vineyard. He put a wall around it, made a winepress, and built a watchtower. Then he leased it to vineyard workers and went on a trip.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When the grapes were getting ripe, he sent his servants to the workers to collect his share of the produce.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The workers took his servants and beat one, killed another, and stoned a third to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the landowner sent more servants. But the workers treated them the same way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Finally, he sent his son to them. He thought, ‘They will respect my son.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When the workers saw his son, they said to one another, ‘This is the heir. Let’s kill him and get his inheritance.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they grabbed him, threw him out of the vineyard, and killed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now, when the owner of the vineyard comes, what will he do to those workers?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered, “He will destroy those evil people. Then he will lease the vineyard to other workers who will give him his share of the produce when it is ready.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus asked them, “Have you never read in the Scriptures:
‘The stone that the builders rejected
has become the cornerstone.
The Lord is responsible for this,
and it is amazing for us to see’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That is why I can guarantee that God’s kingdom will be taken away from you and given to a people who will produce what God wants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who falls on this stone will be broken. If the stone falls on anyone, it will crush that person.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the chief priests and the Pharisees heard his illustrations, they knew that he was talking about them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They wanted to arrest him but were afraid of the crowds, who thought he was a prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again Jesus used stories as illustrations when he spoke to them. He said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The kingdom of heaven is like a king who planned a wedding for his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sent his servants to those who had been invited to the wedding, but they refused to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sent other servants to tell the people who had been invited, ‘I’ve prepared dinner. My bulls and fattened calves have been butchered. Everything is ready. Come to the wedding!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But they paid no attention and went away. Some went to work in their own fields, and others went to their businesses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rest grabbed the king’s servants, mistreated them, and then killed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The king became angry. He sent his soldiers, killed those murderers, and burned their city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the king said to his servants, ‘The wedding is ready, but those who were invited don’t deserve the honor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go where the roads leave the city. Invite everyone you find to the wedding.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The servants went into the streets and brought in all the good people and all the evil people they found. And the wedding hall was filled with guests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When the king came to see the guests, he saw a person who was not dressed in the wedding clothes provided for the guests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said to him, ‘Friend, how did you get in here without proper wedding clothes?’
“The man had nothing to say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king told his servants, ‘Tie his hands and feet, and throw him outside into the darkness. People will cry and be in extreme pain there.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore, many are invited, but few of those are chosen to stay.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Pharisees went away and planned to trap Jesus into saying the wrong thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They sent their disciples to him along with Herod’s followers. They said to him, “Teacher, we know that you tell the truth and that you teach the truth about the way of God. You don’t favor individuals because of who they are.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So tell us what you think. Is it right to pay taxes to the emperor or not?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus recognized their evil plan, so he asked, “Why do you test me, you hypocrites?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Show me a coin used to pay taxes.”
They brought him a coin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Whose face and name is this?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They replied, “The emperor’s.”
Then he said to them, “Very well, give the emperor what belongs to the emperor, and give God what belongs to God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were surprised to hear this. Then they left him alone and went away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day some Sadducees, who say that people will never come back to life, came to Jesus. They asked him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Teacher, Moses said, ‘If a man dies childless, his brother should marry his widow and have children for his brother.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were seven brothers among us. The first married and died. Since he had no children, he left his widow to his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The second brother also died, as well as the third, and the rest of the seven brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At last the woman died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, when the dead come back to life, whose wife will she be? All seven brothers had been married to her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “You’re mistaken because you don’t know the Scriptures or God’s power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When people come back to life, they don’t marry. Rather, they are like the angels in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Haven’t you read what God told you about the dead coming back to life? He said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘I am the God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.’ He’s not the God of the dead but of the living.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He amazed the crowds who heard his teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Pharisees heard that Jesus had silenced the Sadducees, they gathered together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of them, an expert in Moses’ Teachings, tested Jesus by asking,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Teacher, which commandment is the greatest in Moses’ Teachings?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “ ‘Love the Lord your God with all your heart, with all your soul, and with all your mind.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the greatest and most important commandment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The second is like it: ‘Love your neighbor as you love yourself.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of Moses’ Teachings and the Prophets depend on these two commandments.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While the Pharisees were still gathered, Jesus asked them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“What do you think about the Messiah? Whose son is he?”
They answered him, “David’s.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Then how can David, guided by the Spirit, call him Lord? David says,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘The Lord said to my Lord,
“Take the honored position—the one next to me [and the Father] on the heavenly throne
until I put your enemies under your control.” ’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If David calls him Lord, how can he be his son?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one could answer him, and from that time on no one dared to ask him another question.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to the crowds and to his disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The experts in Moses’ Teachings and the Pharisees teach with Moses’ authority.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So be careful to do everything they tell you. But don’t follow their example, because they don’t practice what they preach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They make loads that are hard to carry and lay them on the shoulders of the people. However, they are not willing to lift a finger to move them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “They do everything to attract people’s attention. They make their headbands large and the tassels on their shawls long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They love the place of honor at dinners and the front seats in synagogues.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They love to be greeted in the marketplaces and to have people call them Rabbi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But don’t make others call you Rabbi, because you have only one teacher, and you are all followers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And don’t call anyone on earth your father, because you have only one Father, and he is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t make others call you a leader, because you have only one leader, the Messiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The person who is greatest among you will be your servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever honors himself will be humbled, and whoever humbles himself will be honored.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How horrible it will be for you, experts in Moses’ Teachings and Pharisees! You hypocrites! You lock people out of the kingdom of heaven. You don’t enter it yourselves, and you don’t permit others to enter when they try.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How horrible it will be for you, experts in Moses’ Teachings and Pharisees! You hypocrites! You cross land and sea to recruit a single follower, and when you do, you make that person twice as fit for hell as you are.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How horrible it will be for you, you blind guides! You say, ‘To swear an oath by the temple doesn’t mean a thing. But to swear an oath by the gold in the temple means a person must keep his oath.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You blind fools! What is more important, the gold or the temple that made the gold holy?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again you say, ‘To swear an oath by the altar doesn’t mean a thing. But to swear an oath by the gift on the altar means a person must keep his oath.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You blind men! What is more important, the gift or the altar that makes the gift holy?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To swear an oath by the altar is to swear by it and by everything on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To swear an oath by the temple is to swear by it and by the one who lives there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And to swear an oath by heaven is to swear by God’s throne and the one who sits on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How horrible it will be for you, experts in Moses’ Teachings and Pharisees! You hypocrites! You give God one-tenth of your mint, dill, and cumin. But you have neglected justice, mercy, and faithfulness. These are the most important things in Moses’ Teachings. You should have done these things without neglecting the others.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You blind guides! You strain gnats out of your wine, but you swallow camels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How horrible it will be for you, experts in Moses’ Teachings and Pharisees! You hypocrites! You clean the outside of cups and dishes. But inside they are full of greed and uncontrolled desires.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You blind Pharisees! First clean the inside of the cups and dishes so that the outside may also be clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How horrible it will be for you, experts in Moses’ Teachings and Pharisees! You hypocrites! You are like whitewashed graves that look beautiful on the outside but inside are full of dead people’s bones and every kind of impurity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So on the outside you look as though you have God’s approval, but inside you are full of hypocrisy and lawlessness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How horrible it will be for you, experts in Moses’ Teachings and Pharisees! You hypocrites! You build tombs for the prophets and decorate the monuments of those who had God’s approval.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you say, ‘If we had lived at the time of our ancestors, we would not have helped to murder the prophets.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you testify against yourselves that you are the descendants of those who murdered the prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go ahead, finish what your ancestors started!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You snakes! You poisonous snakes! How can you escape being condemned to hell?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’m sending you prophets, wise men, and teachers of the Scriptures. You will kill and crucify some of them. Others you will whip in your synagogues and persecute from city to city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a result, you will be held accountable for all the innocent blood of those murdered on earth. This includes the murder of Abel, who had God’s approval, to that of Zechariah, son of Barachiah, whom you murdered between the temple and the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can guarantee this truth: The people living now will be held accountable for all these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Jerusalem, Jerusalem, you kill the prophets and stone to death those sent to you! How often I wanted to gather your children together the way a hen gathers her chicks under her wings! But you were not willing!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your house will be abandoned, deserted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can guarantee that you will not see me again until you say, ‘Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the Lord!’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus left the temple courtyard and was walking away, his disciples came to him. They proudly pointed out to him the temple buildings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “You see all these buildings, don’t you? I can guarantee this truth: Not one of these stones will be left on top of another. Each one will be torn down.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus was sitting on the Mount of Olives, his disciples came to him privately and said, “Tell us, when will this happen? What will be the sign that you are coming again, and when will the world come to an end?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Be careful not to let anyone deceive you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many will come using my name. They will say, ‘I am the Messiah,’ and they will deceive many people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You will hear of wars and rumors of wars. Don’t be alarmed! These things must happen, but they don’t mean that the end has come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nation will fight against nation and kingdom against kingdom. There will be famines and earthquakes in various places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of these are only the beginning pains of the end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then they will hand you over to those who will torture and kill you. All nations will hate you because you are committed to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then many will lose faith. They will betray and hate each other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many false prophets will appear and deceive many people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And because there will be more and more lawlessness, most people’s love will grow cold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the person who endures to the end will be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This Good News about the kingdom will be spread throughout the world as a testimony to all nations. Then the end will come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The prophet Daniel said that the disgusting thing that will cause destruction will stand in the holy place. When you see this (let the reader take note),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: those of you in Judea should flee to the mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who are on the roof should not come down to get anything out of their houses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who are in the field should not turn back to get their coats.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How horrible it will be for the women who are pregnant or who are nursing babies in those days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pray that it will not be winter or a day of rest—a holy day, when you flee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There will be a lot of misery at that time, a kind of misery that has not happened from the beginning of the world until now and will certainly never happen again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If God does not reduce the number of those days, no one will be saved. But those days will be reduced because of those whom God has chosen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At that time don’t believe anyone who tells you, ‘Here is the Messiah!’ or ‘There he is!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: False messiahs and false prophets will appear. They will work spectacular, miraculous signs and do wonderful things to deceive, if possible, even those whom God has chosen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Listen! I’ve told you this before it happens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if someone tells you, ‘He’s in the desert!’ don’t go out looking for him. And don’t believe anyone who says, ‘He’s in a secret place!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of Man will come again just as lightning flashes from east to west.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Vultures will gather wherever there is a dead body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Immediately after the misery of those days, the sun will turn dark, the moon will not give light, the stars will fall from the sky, and the powers of the universe will be shaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the sign of the Son of Man will appear in the sky. All the people on earth will cry in agony when they see the Son of Man coming on the clouds in the sky with power and great glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will send out his angels with a loud trumpet call, and from every direction under the sky, they will gather those whom God has chosen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Learn from the story of the fig tree. When its branch becomes tender and it sprouts leaves, you know that summer is near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way, when you see all these things, you know that he is near, at the door.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I can guarantee this truth: This generation will not disappear until all these things take place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The earth and the heavens will disappear, but my words will never disappear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No one knows when that day or hour will come. Even the angels in heaven and the Son don’t know. Only the Father knows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When the Son of Man comes again, it will be exactly like the days of Noah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the days before the flood, people were eating, drinking, and getting married until the day that Noah went into the ship.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were not aware of what was happening until the flood came and swept all of them away. That is how it will be when the Son of Man comes again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At that time two men will be working in the field. One will be taken, and the other one will be left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two women will be working at a mill. One will be taken, and the other one will be left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore, be alert, because you don’t know on what day your Lord will return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You realize that if a homeowner had known at what time of the night a thief was coming, he would have stayed awake. He would not have let the thief break into his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, you, too, must be ready because the Son of Man will return when you least expect him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Who, then, is the faithful and wise servant? The master will put that person in charge of giving the other servants their food at the right time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That servant will be blessed if his master finds him doing this job when he comes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can guarantee this truth: He will put that servant in charge of all his property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the other hand, that servant, if he is wicked, may think that it will be a long time before his master comes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The servant may begin to beat the other servants and eat and drink with the drunks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His master will return unexpectedly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his master will severely punish him and assign him a place with the hypocrites. People will cry and be in extreme pain there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When the end comes, the kingdom of heaven will be like ten bridesmaids. They took their oil lamps and went to meet the groom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Five of them were foolish, and five were wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The foolish bridesmaids took their lamps, but they didn’t take any extra oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wise bridesmaids, however, took along extra oil for their lamps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since the groom was late, all the bridesmaids became drowsy and fell asleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At midnight someone shouted, ‘The groom is here! Come to meet him!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the bridesmaids woke up and got their lamps ready.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The foolish ones said to the wise ones, ‘Give us some of your oil. Our lamps are going out.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But the wise bridesmaids replied, ‘We can’t do that. There won’t be enough for both of us. Go! Find someone to sell you some oil.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “While they were buying oil, the groom arrived. The bridesmaids who were ready went with him into the wedding hall, and the door was shut.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Later the other bridesmaids arrived and said, ‘Sir, sir, open the door for us!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But he answered them, ‘I don’t even know who you are!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So stay awake, because you don’t know the day or the hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The kingdom of heaven is like a man going on a trip. He called his servants and entrusted some money to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He gave one man ten thousand dollars, another four thousand dollars, and another two thousand dollars. Each was given money based on his ability. Then the man went on his trip.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The one who received ten thousand dollars invested the money at once and doubled his money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who had four thousand dollars did the same and also doubled his money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the one who received two thousand dollars went off, dug a hole in the ground, and hid his master’s money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “After a long time the master of those servants returned and settled accounts with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who received ten thousand dollars brought the additional ten thousand. He said, ‘Sir, you gave me ten thousand dollars. I’ve doubled the amount.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “His master replied, ‘Good job! You’re a good and faithful servant! You proved that you could be trusted with a small amount. I will put you in charge of a large amount. Come and share your master’s happiness.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The one who received four thousand dollars came and said, ‘Sir, you gave me four thousand dollars. I’ve doubled the amount.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “His master replied, ‘Good job! You’re a good and faithful servant! You proved that you could be trusted with a small amount. I will put you in charge of a large amount. Come and share your master’s happiness.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the one who received two thousand dollars came and said, ‘Sir, I knew that you are a hard person to please. You harvest where you haven’t planted and gather where you haven’t scattered any seeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was afraid. So I hid your two thousand dollars in the ground. Here’s your money!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “His master responded, ‘You evil and lazy servant! If you knew that I harvest where I haven’t planted and gather where I haven’t scattered,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then you should have invested my money with the bankers. When I returned, I would have received my money back with interest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take the two thousand dollars away from him! Give it to the one who has the ten thousand!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To all who have, more will be given, and they will have more than enough. But everything will be taken away from those who don’t have much.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Throw this useless servant outside into the darkness. People will cry and be in extreme pain there.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When the Son of Man comes in his glory and all his angels are with him, he will sit on his glorious throne.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people of every nation will be gathered in front of him. He will separate them as a shepherd separates the sheep from the goats.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will put the sheep on his right but the goats on his left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the king will say to those on his right, ‘Come, my Father has blessed you! Inherit the kingdom prepared for you from the creation of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was hungry, and you gave me something to eat. I was thirsty, and you gave me something to drink. I was a stranger, and you took me into your home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I needed clothes, and you gave me something to wear. I was sick, and you took care of me. I was in prison, and you visited me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the people who have God’s approval will reply to him, ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry and feed you or see you thirsty and give you something to drink?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When did we see you as a stranger and take you into our homes or see you in need of clothes and give you something to wear?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When did we see you sick or in prison and visit you?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The king will answer them, ‘I can guarantee this truth: Whatever you did for one of my brothers or sisters, no matter how unimportant they seemed, you did for me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the king will say to those on his left, ‘Get away from me! God has cursed you! Go into everlasting fire that was prepared for the devil and his angels!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was hungry, and you gave me nothing to eat. I was thirsty, and you gave me nothing to drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was a stranger, and you didn’t take me into your homes. I needed clothes, and you didn’t give me anything to wear. I was sick and in prison, and you didn’t take care of me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “They, too, will ask, ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry or thirsty or as a stranger or in need of clothes or sick or in prison and didn’t help you?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He will answer them, ‘I can guarantee this truth: Whatever you failed to do for one of my brothers or sisters, no matter how unimportant they seemed, you failed to do for me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “These people will go away into eternal punishment, but those with God’s approval will go into eternal life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus finished saying all these things, he told his disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You know that the Passover will take place in two days. At that time the Son of Man will be handed over to be crucified.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the chief priests and the leaders of the people gathered in the palace of the chief priest Caiaphas.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made plans to arrest Jesus in an underhanded way and to kill him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they said, “We shouldn’t arrest him during the festival, or else there may be a riot among the people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus was in Bethany in the home of Simon, a man who had suffered from a skin disease.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Jesus was sitting there, a woman went to him with a bottle of very expensive perfume and poured it on his head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples were irritated when they saw this. They asked, “Why did she waste it like this?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It could have been sold for a high price, and the money could have been given to the poor.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since Jesus knew what was going on, he said to them, “Why are you bothering this woman? She has done a beautiful thing for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will always have the poor with you, but you will not always have me with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She poured this perfume on my body before it is placed in a tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can guarantee this truth: Wherever this Good News is spoken in the world, what she has done will also be told in memory of her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one of the twelve apostles, the one named Judas Iscariot, went to the chief priests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He asked, “What will you pay me if I hand him over to you?”
They offered him 30 silver coins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From then on, he looked for a chance to betray Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the first day of the Festival of Unleavened Bread, the disciples went to Jesus. They asked, “Where do you want us to prepare the Passover meal for you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Go to a certain man in the city, and tell him that the teacher says, ‘My time is near. I will celebrate the Passover with my disciples at your house.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples did as Jesus had directed them and prepared the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When evening came, Jesus was at the table with the twelve apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were eating, he said, “I can guarantee this truth: One of you is going to betray me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Feeling deeply hurt, they asked him one by one, “You don’t mean me, do you, Lord?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “Someone who has dipped his hand into the bowl with me will betray me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of Man is going to die as the Scriptures say he will. But how horrible it will be for that person who betrays the Son of Man. It would have been better for that person if he had never been born.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Judas, who betrayed him, asked, “You don’t mean me, do you, Rabbi?”
“Yes, I do,” Jesus replied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were eating, Jesus took bread and blessed it. He broke the bread, gave it to his disciples, and said, “Take this, and eat it. This is my body.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he took a cup and spoke a prayer of thanksgiving. He gave it to them and said, “Drink from it, all of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is my blood, the blood of the promise. It is poured out for many people so that sins are forgiven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I can guarantee that I won’t drink this wine again until that day when I drink new wine with you in my Father’s kingdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After they sang a hymn, they went to the Mount of Olives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Jesus said to them, “All of you will abandon me tonight. Scripture says,
‘I will strike the shepherd,
and the sheep in the flock will be scattered.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But after I am brought back to life, I will go to Galilee ahead of you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said to him, “Even if everyone else abandons you, I never will.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied to Peter, “I can guarantee this truth: Before a rooster crows tonight, you will say three times that you don’t know me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter told him, “Even if I have to die with you, I’ll never say that I don’t know you!” All the other disciples said the same thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus went with the disciples to a place called Gethsemane. He said to them, “Stay here while I go over there and pray.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took Peter and Zebedee’s two sons with him. He was beginning to feel deep anguish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to them, “My anguish is so great that I feel as if I’m dying. Wait here, and stay awake with me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After walking a little farther, he quickly bowed with his face to the ground and prayed, “Father, if it’s possible, let this cup of suffering be taken away from me. But let your will be done rather than mine.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he went back to the disciples, he found them asleep. He said to Peter, “Couldn’t you stay awake with me for one hour?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Stay awake, and pray that you won’t be tempted. You want to do what’s right, but you’re weak.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he went away a second time and prayed, “Father, if this cup cannot be taken away unless I drink it, let your will be done.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He found them asleep again because they couldn’t keep their eyes open.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After leaving them again, he went away and prayed the same prayer a third time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he came back to the disciples and said to them, “You might as well sleep now. The time is near for the Son of Man to be handed over to sinners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Get up! Let’s go! The one who is betraying me is near.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just then, while Jesus was still speaking, Judas, one of the twelve apostles, arrived. A large crowd carrying swords and clubs was with him. They were from the chief priests and leaders of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, the traitor had given them a signal. He said, “The one I kiss is the man you want. Arrest him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Judas quickly stepped up to Jesus and said, “Hello, Rabbi!” and kissed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus said to him, “Friend, why are you here?”
Then some men came forward, took hold of Jesus, and arrested him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suddenly, one of the men with Jesus pulled out his sword and cut off the ear of the chief priest’s servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to him, “Put your sword away! All who use a sword will be killed by a sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t you think that I could call on my Father to send more than twelve legions of angels to help me now?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How, then, are the Scriptures to be fulfilled that say this must happen?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Jesus said to the crowd, “Have you come out with swords and clubs to arrest me as if I were a criminal? I used to sit teaching in the temple courtyard every day. But you didn’t arrest me then.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All of this has happened so that what the prophets have written would come true.”
Then all the disciples abandoned him and ran away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who had arrested Jesus took him to Caiaphas, the chief priest, where the experts in Moses’ Teachings and the leaders had gathered together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter followed at a distance until he came to the chief priest’s courtyard. He went inside and sat with the guards to see how this would turn out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief priests and the whole council were searching for false testimony to use against Jesus in order to execute him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they did not find any, although many came forward with false testimony. At last two men came forward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They stated, “This man said, ‘I can tear down God’s temple and rebuild it in three days.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief priest stood up and said to Jesus, “Don’t you have any answer to what these men testify against you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But Jesus was silent.
Then the chief priest said to him, “Swear an oath in front of the living God and tell us, are you the Messiah, the Son of God?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “Yes, I am. But I alone can guarantee that from now on you will see the Son of Man in the honored position—the one next to God the Father on the heavenly throne . He will be coming on the clouds of heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the chief priest tore his robes in horror and said, “He has dishonored God! Why do we need any more witnesses? You’ve just heard him dishonor God!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What’s your verdict?”
They answered, “He deserves the death penalty!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they spit in his face, hit him with their fists, and some of them slapped him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “You Christ, if you’re a prophet, tell us who hit you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter was sitting in the courtyard. A female servant came to him and said, “You, too, were with Jesus the Galilean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter denied it in front of them all by saying, “I don’t know what you’re talking about.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he went to the entrance, another female servant saw him. She told those who were there, “This man was with Jesus from Nazareth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again Peter denied it and swore with an oath, “I don’t know the man!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After a little while the men standing there approached Peter and said, “It’s obvious you’re also one of them. Your accent gives you away!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter began to curse and swear with an oath, “I don’t know the man!” Just then a rooster crowed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter remembered what Jesus had said: “Before a rooster crows, you will say three times that you don’t know me.” Then Peter went outside and cried bitterly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Early in the morning all the chief priests and the leaders of the people decided to execute Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They tied him up, led him away, and handed him over to Pilate, the governor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Judas, who had betrayed Jesus, regretted what had happened when he saw that Jesus was condemned. He brought the 30 silver coins back to the chief priests and leaders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said, “I’ve sinned by betraying an innocent man.”
They replied, “What do we care? That’s your problem.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he threw the money into the temple, went away, and hanged himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief priests took the money and said, “It’s not right to put it into the temple treasury, because it’s blood money.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they decided to use it to buy a potter’s field for the burial of strangers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That’s why that field has been called the Field of Blood ever since.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then what the prophet Jeremiah had said came true, “They took the 30 silver coins, the price the people of Israel had placed on him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and used the coins to buy a potter’s field, as the Lord had directed me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus stood in front of the governor, Pilate. The governor asked him, “Are you the king of the Jews?”
“Yes, I am,” Jesus answered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While the chief priests and leaders were accusing him, he said nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate asked him, “Don’t you hear how many charges they’re bringing against you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said absolutely nothing to him in reply, so the governor was very surprised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At every Passover festival the governor would free one prisoner whom the crowd wanted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time there was a well-known prisoner by the name of Barabbas.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when the people gathered, Pilate asked them, “Which man do you want me to free for you? Do you want me to free Barabbas or Jesus, who is called Christ?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate knew that they had handed Jesus over to him because they were jealous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Pilate was judging the case, his wife sent him a message. It said, “Leave that innocent man alone. I’ve been very upset today because of a dream I had about him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the chief priests and leaders persuaded the crowd to ask for the release of Barabbas and the execution of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The governor asked them, “Which of the two do you want me to free for you?”
They said, “Barabbas.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pilate asked them, “Then what should I do with Jesus, who is called Christ?”
“He should be crucified!” they all said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pilate asked, “Why? What has he done wrong?”
But they began to shout loudly, “He should be crucified!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate saw that he was not getting anywhere. Instead, a riot was breaking out. So Pilate took some water and washed his hands in front of the crowd. He said, “I won’t be guilty of killing this man. Do what you want!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the people answered, “The responsibility for killing him will rest on us and our children.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate freed Barabbas for the people. But he had Jesus whipped and handed over to be crucified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the governor’s soldiers took Jesus into the palace and gathered the whole troop around him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They took off his clothes and put a bright red cape on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They twisted some thorns into a crown, placed it on his head, and put a stick in his right hand. They knelt in front of him and made fun of him by saying, “Long live the king of the Jews!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After they had spit on him, they took the stick and kept hitting him on the head with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the soldiers finished making fun of Jesus, they took off the cape and put his own clothes back on him. Then they led him away to crucify him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the way they found a man named Simon. He was from the city of Cyrene. The soldiers forced him to carry Jesus’ cross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came to a place called Golgotha (which means “the place of the skull”).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They gave him a drink of wine mixed with a drug called gall. When he tasted it, he refused to drink it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After they had crucified him, they divided his clothes among themselves by throwing dice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they sat there and kept watch over him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They placed a written accusation above his head. It read, “This is Jesus, the king of the Jews.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time they crucified two criminals with him, one on his right and the other on his left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who passed by insulted him. They shook their heads
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “You were going to tear down God’s temple and build it again in three days. Save yourself! If you’re the Son of God, come down from the cross.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief priests together with the experts in Moses’ Teachings and the leaders made fun of him in the same way. They said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He saved others, but he can’t save himself. So he’s Israel’s king! Let him come down from the cross now, and we’ll believe him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He trusted God. Let God rescue him now if he wants. After all, this man said, ‘I am the Son of God.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even the criminals crucified with him were insulting him the same way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At noon darkness came over the whole land until three in the afternoon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About three o’clock Jesus cried out in a loud voice, “Eli, Eli, lema sabachthani?” which means, “My God, my God, why have you abandoned me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When some of the people standing there heard him say that, they said, “He’s calling Elijah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the men ran at once, took a sponge, and soaked it in some vinegar. Then he put it on a stick and offered Jesus a drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The others said, “Leave him alone! Let’s see if Elijah comes to save him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus loudly cried out once again and gave up his life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suddenly, the curtain in the temple was split in two from top to bottom. The earth shook, and the rocks were split open.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tombs were opened, and the bodies of many holy people who had died came back to life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came out of the tombs after he had come back to life, and they went into the holy city where they appeared to many people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An army officer and those watching Jesus with him saw the earthquake and the other things happening. They were terrified and said, “Certainly, this was the Son of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many women were there watching from a distance. They had followed Jesus from Galilee and had always supported him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Among them were Mary from Magdala, Mary (the mother of James and Joseph), and the mother of Zebedee’s sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the evening a rich man named Joseph arrived. He was from the city of Arimathea and had become a disciple of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus. Pilate ordered that it be given to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph took the body and wrapped it in a clean linen cloth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he laid it in his own new tomb, which had been cut in a rock. After rolling a large stone against the door of the tomb, he went away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mary from Magdala and the other Mary were sitting there, facing the tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day, which was the day of rest—a holy day, the chief priests and Pharisees gathered together and went to Pilate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “Sir, we remember how that deceiver said while he was still alive, ‘After three days I will be brought back to life.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, give the order to make the tomb secure until the third day. Otherwise, his disciples may steal him and say to the people, ‘He has been brought back to life.’ Then the last deception will be worse than the first.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate told them, “You have the soldiers you want for guard duty. Go and make the tomb as secure as you know how.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they went to secure the tomb. They placed a seal on the stone and posted the soldiers on guard duty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the day of rest—a holy day, as the sun rose Sunday morning, Mary from Magdala and the other Mary went to look at the tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suddenly, there was a powerful earthquake. An angel of the Lord had come down from heaven, rolled the stone away, and was sitting on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was as bright as lightning, and his clothes were as white as snow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The guards were so deathly afraid of him that they shook.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel said to the women, “Don’t be afraid! I know you’re looking for Jesus, who was crucified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He’s not here. He has been brought back to life as he said. Come, see the place where he was lying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then go quickly, and tell his disciples that he has been brought back to life. He’s going ahead of them into Galilee. There they will see him. Take note that I have told you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They hurried away from the tomb with fear and great joy and ran to tell his disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suddenly, Jesus met them and greeted them. They went up to him, bowed down to worship him, and took hold of his feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, “Don’t be afraid! Go, tell my followers to go to Galilee. There they will see me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While the women were on their way, some of the guards went into the city. They told the chief priests everything that had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief priests gathered together with the leaders and agreed on a plan. They gave the soldiers a large amount of money
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and told them to say that Jesus’ disciples had come at night and had stolen his body while they were sleeping.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They added, “If the governor hears about it, we’ll take care of it, and you’ll have nothing to worry about.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The soldiers took the money and did as they were told. Their story has been spread among the Jewish people to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eleven disciples went to the mountain in Galilee where Jesus had told them to go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they saw him, they bowed down in worship, though some had doubts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus came near, he spoke to them. He said, “All authority in heaven and on earth has been given to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So wherever you go, make disciples of all nations: Baptize them in the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Teach them to do everything I have commanded you.
“And remember that I am always with you until the end of time.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
